children.title: Which markets can I trade in?
children.content: We offer a comprehensive range of FX pairs, precious metals, commodities, and global indices.

children.title: What leverage do you offer?
children.content: Tiger Brokers UK offers up to 30:1 leverage depending on the product being traded. Higher leverage is available for 'Professional' clients. Please contact ________________ to discuss upgrading your account to Professional status.

children.title: Where can I find the product specifications?
children.content: Product specifications are listed in the 'Markets' section of the app. Select a product and open up a trade window. Then click on the '?' icon for detailed product information.

children.title: What types of account are available?
children.content: Tiger Brokers offers an Experience account on which to practice trading with virtual funds, and a Live account on which to trade with real funds.

children.title: How do I open an account?
children.content: Please download our app from Google Play or the App Store. Once you have registered, you will be invited to open an Experience or a Live account.

children.title: How long does it take to open an account?
children.content: Demo Account are opened immediately. A Live account will normally be approved within minutes; however, we may request copies of ID to complete the process.

children.title: What documents do I need to provide?
children.content: For UK residents, we do not normally request copies of ID documents. For non-UK residents we may ask you for a copy of your passport, national ID Card or driving licence, and a utility bill or bank statement confirming your address.

children.title: Why am I being deducted the inactivity fee from my account?
children.content: For clients who have registered for more than three months and have not successfully traded or deposited in the past three months, the platform will automatically charge a $10 inactivity fee at 20:00 (GMT+8) on the last day of each month.

title: How do I deposit or withdraw money?

children.title: How do I fund my account?
children.content: Please register your bank card details on the app and then manage deposits in the 'Payments' section.

children.title: What is the minimum deposit?
children.content: The minimum deposit is GBP50.

children.title: How long does it take to transfer funds?
children.content: Deposits are usually credited to your account immediately. We process withdrawal requests immediately and expect all funds to be returned within three working days.

children.title: How do I withdraw funds?
children.content: Manage withdrawals in the ‘Payments’ section of the app. You can withdraw funds at any time, although we recommend that you maintain a surplus of margin in your account if you have open positions. Tiger Brokers does not charge clients to make a withdrawal.

children.title: What is the minimum withdrawal?
children.content: The minimum withdrawal is GBP20.

children.title: What are the restrictions on withdrawal?
children.content: Only the approved live accounts can withdraw funds; clients can only withdraw after depositing; Trading behavior is required after depositing; The minimum withdrawal amount is USD30.

children.title: Are there any withdrawal fees?
children.content: Tiger Brokers does not charge any withdrawal fees.

children.title: What is the minimum order size?
children.content: Our minimum order size is 0.01 lot for FX and precious metals, and 0.1 for commodities and indices.

children.title: What trading fees do you charge?
children.content: We do not charge any commission - only spread. Our FX spreads are variable and from 0.6. Overnight swaps and financing adjustments are applied to positions held overnight.

children.title: When am I able to trade on the platform?
children.content: From Sunday 21:05 UTC through to Friday 20:55 UTC.

children.title: Why was my order closed forcibly?
children.content: When the Trading account, copy account or master account margin level (margin level = Total equity / Margin * 100%) is lower than 20%, the system will activate the liquidation mechanism, and the position will be closed from the order with the largest loss.

children.title: Is there a time limit on holding a position or limit on the number of orders I can have open at any one time?
children.content: There are no time limits on open orders; however, you must maintain sufficient funds to cover margin requirements and swap adjustments.

children.title: What is slippage and when might it occur?
children.content: Slippage occurs when an order is not filled at a specified price, generally because of low liquidity or price gaps.

title: What is swap and how to check it?

children.title: What is a swap?
children.content: Swaps reflect the interest and financing adjustments applied to a position held overnight. Swaps adjustments may take the form of a credit or a debit to your account, depending on the position held and the direction of the trade. No swaps are applied to trades opened and closed the same day.

children.title: When are swap adjustments applied?
children.content: Swap rates are calculated at 22:00 UTC and applied to eligible accounts shortly afterwards. If positions are held over a weekend, swap rates will increase to reflect that fact.

children.title: Where can I check what swap rates you apply for?
children.content: Swap details can be found on the product information page of a particular product. Swap rates are normally updated daily and are based on prevailing market rates.

children.title: Where can I check what swap fees I have paid or received?
children.content: Accumulated swap adjustments are detailed in your ‘Trade History’ on the app in the ‘Closed positions’ section.
